entertain verb
(AMUSE)
B1 [ I or T ] to keep a group of people interested or enjoying themselves: We hired a magician to entertain the children. Most children's television programmes aim to educate and entertain at the same time.
More examplesFewer examplesMilligan's anarchic humour has always had the power to offend as well as entertain.Year after year they wheel out the same third-rate celebrities to entertain us.Should the function of children's television be to entertain or to enlighten?The crowd was entertained with a display of aerobatics.The crowds were once again entertained by the number one tennis player's antics on and off the court.

entertain verb
